data.title: Server 2003 32-bit or 64-bit
data.meta_description: We have Server 2003 Standard which I need to upgrade to 2008R2. Since 2008R2 is 64-bit only server, in order to upgrade 2003 server it also has to be 64-bit. Computer properties doesn’t give me that information on 2003 b…
data.text:
We have Server 2003 Standard which I need to upgrade to 2008R2. Since 2008R2 is 64-bit only server, in order to upgrade 2003 server it also has to be 64-bit. Computer properties doesn’t give me that information on 2003 box. Is there are other places to look, registry perhaps?

Thanks. Alex.

It’s not the OS that needs to be 64bit - it’s the hardware. If your existing hardware is not 64bit architecture, you will not be able to install a 64bit operating system.

CPU-Z is one way of finding out. Rebooting the machine (if you can) is another – the BIOS should tell you.
